channel.title: BBC News - Africa

item.title: Nigerian students amass degrees to stay in Europe
item.description: Modupe Osunkoya enrolled on her third post-graduate degree because she says there are no jobs at home.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: South Africa's Du Preez lands childhood dream
item.description: South Africa's Pieter du Preez is overcome by emotion as he wins Paralympic gold in men's road cycling.

item.title: Highly polluting leaded petrol now eradicated from the world, says UN
item.description: The highly polluting fuel has contaminated the atmosphere, water and crops for nearly a century.

item.title: Ethiopian Yehualaw breaks half marathon world mark
item.description: Ethiopian Yalemzerf Yehualaw smashes the women's half marathon world record at the Antrim Coast event in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Ethiopia's economy battered by Tigray war
item.description: Food prices are rising, the currency's value is falling and investor confidence is shaken.

item.title: Agnes Sithole: The woman who fought South Africa's sexist marriage laws
item.description: Agnes Sithole became an unlikely hero after her husband of nearly 50 years tried to sell their home.

item.title: Sierra Leone's chimpanzees: The newlyweds who set up a sanctuary
item.description: A couple who 30 years ago bought an abused chimpanzee are now trying to save a subspecies.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 20-26 August 2021
item.description: A selection of the best photos from the African continent and beyond.

item.title: Kenya's Deputy President Ruto campaigns for 'Hustler Nation'
item.description: Deputy President William Ruto is portraying himself as the champion of the poor ahead of elections.

item.title: Strictly: Why are South African dancers so popular?
item.description: As Strictly prepares to return to our screens next month another South African dancer has joined the professionals.

item.title: Kenya: How orphaned elephants' need for milk is empowering Samburu women
item.description: Kenya's Samburu women say selling goats' milk to an elephant sanctuary gives them independence.

item.title: Tortoise eating bird caught on camera by conservationist
item.description: It is believed to be the first time this behaviour of giant tortoises has been documented.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics 2020: Kgothatso Montjane, South Africa's wheelchair tennis hope
item.description: South Africa's wheelchair tennis star Kgothatso Montjane is aiming for a medal at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Kenya holds biggest ever animal census
item.description: All wildlife on land and sea is being counted to help Kenya's conservation plans and tourism.

item.title: How could Africa produce its own vaccines?
item.description: For decades, Africa has imported 99% of its vaccines. So how could it jumpstart local vaccine manufacturing?

item.title: Nigeria's Lai Mohammed: We are winning the war against Boko Haram
item.description: The information minister says Nigeria is winning the war against insecurity and is negotiating with Twitter over the ban.
